intro: Cyathodes articulata, commonly known as the articulated cyathodes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a unique structure called a cyathode, which is a type of inflorescence composed of modified leaves and flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Cyathodes articulata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
